text: Lake Kamyslybas (, Qamystybas) is a large saltwater lake in the Qyzylorda Province, Kazakhstan. It has an area of 176 km², although the water level in the lake often fluctuates. It lies in the northern part of Syr Darya's delta, to which it is connected by a canal. Lake Kamyslybas is used as a fishery. Category:Lakes of Kazakhstan Category:Saline lakes of Asia Category:Endorheic lakes of Asia
title: Lake Kamyslybas
